intro: Plagiobothrys nitens, commonly known as the slender woollystar, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Due to its limited range and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
